intro: Palala carinata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Palala carinata thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
